column1: 4CBD267F-A312-405E-8475-8A428D7E0EA9#appfire#D37222B5-A533-443E-8261-3B815DF1D944#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-13 10:19:37.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-13 10:19:37.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#81D447AC-814B-4D01-989E-96D52C874D6A#appfire#D37222B5-A533-443E-8261-3B815DF1D944#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-13 10:19:37.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-13 10:19:37.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#9470E189-6820-4148-AB30-21004EE7134F#appfire#D37222B5-A533-443E-8261-3B815DF1D944#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-13 10:19:37.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-13 10:19:37.0#appfire#1
